args.description: If passed and user has the "can_view_organization_locations" permission, additional locations with "isPublic=false" will be returned.

args.description: Optionally exclude locations that are not in these groups

fields.name: checkLocationSlug
fields.description: Check if a location slug is available.

args.description: The slug to check. This value can be any string. It will be slugified before being checked.

args.name: organizationId
args.description: The organization id

args.name: locationId
args.description: If set, will treat a slug that matches the current location slug as valid.

fields.name: checkStoreNum
fields.description: Check if a store num is available.

args.name: storeNum
args.description: The store num to check. This value can be any string.

args.name: organizationId
args.description: The organization id

args.name: locationId
args.description: If set, will treat a store num that matches the current location store num as valid.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.description: The room inside the location

fields.name: connected
fields.description: If the AP is currently connected

fields.name: socketId
fields.description: The socket id of the connection (or last connection)

fields.description: The key that uniquely identifies the AP

fields.name: nodeId

fields.name: sid
fields.description: Unique id that comes from twilio

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the message. May be one of: "scheduled", "accepted", "queued", "sending", "sent", "failed", "delivered", "undelivered", "receiving", "received"

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of message. May be one of "promo", "trans", "auth". Default is "promo"

fields.name: to
fields.description: The phone number to send the message to. May be null

fields.name: from
fields.description: The phone number that sent or will send the message. May be null

fields.name: body
fields.description: The content of the message

fields.name: sendAt
fields.description: If set, will not send the message until the specified time. If null will send immediately

fields.name: webViewQueryData
fields.description: If linksToWebView=true, additional data that is passed when the link is followed to allow for deep linking

fields.name: linksToWebView
fields.description: Whether to include a link with the message. Can be used in conjunction with webViewQueryData to deep link.

fields.name: acl

fields.name: developerEmail

fields.name: isDefault
fields.description: Whether this is a default job. Default jobs may not be changed or have their ACLs updated

fields.name: role
fields.description: The base role for this job. Will initially inherit the default values for this role but (if it is not a default Job) may have custom permissions set after creation. Will be one of: "owner", "groupManager", "manager", "teammate", "guest"

fields.name: name
fields.description: The Job name. This should be a user-facing friendly name

fields.name: acl
fields.description: Custom ACL list of permissions. This will be ignored if isDefault=true.

fields.name: inStoreAcl
fields.description: Custom ACL list of permission overrides requiring a user to be online. This will be ignored if isDefault=true.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier (per skill) of the card

fields.name: comment
fields.description: A comment meant for developers.  Not public facing

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the card that will display in the sidebar

fields.name: skillSlug
fields.description: The unique identifier of the skill

fields.name: page
fields.description: The unique page where the card can be shown in core.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: Array of roles that this card is available to. Valid options are: "owner", "groupManager", "manager", "teammate", "guest".

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of this card that will show in the sidebar

fields.name: order
fields.description: The order the user has sorted the cards by.

fields.name: isTemporary
fields.description: Denotes if this is a temporary card. Temporary cards do not display in the sidebar.

fields.name: isCentered
fields.description: Denotes if this card is centered

fields.name: canDismiss
fields.description: Denotes if the user may dismiss this card

fields.name: cardBuilder
fields.description: The card builder structure

fields.name: header
fields.description: The header for the card layout

fields.name: headerImage
fields.description: Ability to drop in a header image in place of the default header

fields.name: onboarding
fields.description: Building an onboarding card? Set your steps here

fields.name: body
fields.description: The content for the main area of the card that contains many bodies

fields.name: footer
fields.description: The footer layout of the card

types.name: CardHeaderType
types.description: The header area of a card

fields.name: title
fields.description: The header title

fields.name: labelText
fields.description: The header icon

fields.name: labelIcon
fields.description: The header icon text

fields.name: actions
fields.description: Header actions

fields.name: contextMenu
fields.description: Render a context menu

types.name: ButtonType
types.description: The actions a user may take

fields.name: className
fields.description: Optional class to add to the button

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Sets the visual appearance of the button. May be primary, secondary, simple, or caution

fields.name: isSmall
fields.description: Set true to make the button less tall

fields.name: isFullWidth
fields.description: Set true to make the button fill its parent's width

fields.name: isLoading
fields.description: Set true to hide any text or icon in the button and show a loader instead

fields.name: isIconOnly
fields.description: Set true to hide any text in the button. Text should still be provided for accessibility

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text for the button

fields.name: href
fields.description: Will render a link. May be relative or absolute

fields.name: icon
fields.description: Icon for the button

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type attribute for HTML button element. Defaults to 'button'.

fields.name: target
fields.description: The target of the link out.

types.name: IconType
types.description: The actions a user may take

fields.name: icon
fields.description: The name of the icon to render. If not found, this will return null

fields.name: isLineIcon
fields.description: Set true to render an icon with a stroke, but no fill

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title rendered at the top of this card

fields.name: steps
fields.description: The title of the card that will display in the sidebar

fields.name: className
fields.description: The unique identifier of the skill

types.name: OnboardingStep
types.description: A single step of the onboarding process

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique id of this step

fields.name: tabTitle
fields.description: Title of the tab for this step.

fields.name: panelTitle
fields.description: Copy that renders in the card's body as the title

fields.name: panelCopy
fields.description: Copy that renders in the card's body under the title

fields.name: panelCTA
fields.description: The call to action at the bottom of this step

fields.name: children
fields.description: The child elements rendered in the body

types.name: CardBodyItemType
types.description: The body of a card layout

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of component to render

fields.name: key
fields.description: A unique key for this element relative to the card it's rendered in

fields.name: props
fields.description: The body text

types.description: The actions a user may take in the footer

fields.name: body

types.name: createJobInput
types.description: Input for creating a new Job

inputFields.name: organizationId
inputFields.description: The id of the organization under which to create the new Job

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The new jobs's name

inputFields.name: role
inputFields.description: The base role for this job. May be: "groupManager", "manager", or "teammate". If "acl" is omitted, the permissions will be inherited from the default role.

inputFields.name: acl
inputFields.description: A key/value pair of ACLs for this Job

inputFields.name: inStoreAcl
inputFields.description: A key/value pair of ACLs that require the user to be online

fields.name: Job
fields.description: The new Job

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The id of the job

fields.name: status
fields.description: Will be "success"

types.name: updateJobInput
types.description: Input for creating a new Job

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The id of the Job to update

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The job's name

inputFields.name: acl
inputFields.description: A key/value pair of ACLs for this Job. This is additive (PATCH) to the existing job acls.

inputFields.name: inStoreAcl
inputFields.description: A key/value pair of ACLs that apply when the user is online only. This is additive (PATCH) to the existing job inStoreAcls. To unset an inStoreAcl set it to false.

inputFields.name: role
inputFields.description: The base role for this job. May be: "groupManager", "manager", or "teammate". If "acl" is omitted, the permissions will be inherited from the default role.

fields.name: Job
fields.description: The Job

types.name: createLocationInput
types.description: Creates a new Location for an Organization

inputFields.name: organizationId
inputFields.description: The id of the organization under which to create the new Location

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The new location's name

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: The new location's slug. If not passed, will attempt to use the slugified location name.

inputFields.name: addressLine1
inputFields.description: Address line 1

inputFields.name: addressLine2
inputFields.description: Address line 2

inputFields.name: addressCity
inputFields.description: The name of the city

inputFields.name: addressState
inputFields.description: The state abbreviation

inputFields.name: addressZip
inputFields.description: The zip code

inputFields.name: addressCountry
inputFields.description: The country

inputFields.name: phoneNumber
inputFields.description: The main phone number for the Location

inputFields.description: Optional query string to include

fields.name: status

args.description: The (string) value to use for fields that are not allowed. Default=null

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
